hypothesis_content.title: Bear-to-Neutral Transition on Diverging Momentum Oscillators
hypothesis_content.statement: In BEAR regime, when BTC makes a lower low (20-day period) but RSI(14) forms a higher low (bullish divergence), AND the divergence is confirmed by similar pattern in Chaikin Money Flow (21-day), regime transitions to NEUTRAL within 7 days with >70% probability.
hypothesis_content.rationale: Momentum divergences during bear markets indicate weakening selling pressure despite lower prices. Confirmation across both price momentum (RSI) and money flow (CMF) suggests institutional accumulation at lower levels. Below-average volume on the divergence confirms lack of aggressive selling, setting up for bear exhaustion and transition to neutral.
entry_conditions: RSI(14) forms higher low vs. prior RSI low (divergence)
Chaikin Money Flow (21-day) shows similar higher low pattern
Divergence occurs on below-average volume (< 30-day avg)

exit_conditions.stop_loss: BTC breaks below divergence low price level
exit_conditions.time_exit: 7 trading days after entry without transition

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: More than 30% of such divergence signals lead to continuation of BEAR regime with new significant lows (>5% below divergence point).
